intro: Trichomanes setilobum, commonly known as the feather moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant has slender, branching stems covered with small, oval-shaped leaves that are often curled at the tips. Trichomanes setilobum is typically found in temperate regions, growing on soil, rocks, or decaying wood. Its simple structure and adaptability make it an important component of forest floor ecosystems.
